channel.title: God mode [317]
channel.description: I'm trying to make a god mode command, so when the player uses it, they won't die. How can I set their health to like 50,000+ ?

item.title: God mode [317]
item.dc:creator: @fafaerer fafaerer
item.description:
@fafaerer wrote:

Go to where your server handles damage upon hp, and make an if statement that depends on a new variable, a boolean which you have to add that will tell whether or not god mode is on, which if is false, the regular loss of damage is enabled, where as if it’s true, it doesn’t. If you want further help, hmu on MSN and I can help you. MSN: support@unknownflyff.com

Read full topic

item.title: God mode [317]
item.dc:creator: @dun_dun_dun dun dun dun
item.description:
@dun_dun_dun wrote:

For a reset command like you’re talking about, I’m just not sure, I’m just used to dying when I want to turn it off.

Read full topic

item.title: God mode [317]
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

What would you both recommend I do for my code? Its a bit messed up…
in order for god mode to activate, I have to type the command, then die (or eat up to 50,000) and to de-activate it, I have a command

	   if (command.startsWith("godoff") && playerRights > 2) {
			sM("God mode disabled");
				playerLevel[3] = 99;
				specialAmount = 100;	
}

for this command I have to either take 50k damage, or die for my health 2 reset…

How can I make it automatically change my health? I was considering using

playerLevel[3] -= 50000;

but that would just kill the player if they had taken any damage since they activated the code.
Any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: God mode [317]
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

dun dun dun:

Try removing the ‘c.’ before ‘playerLevel[3] = 50000;’. Since I’m guessing you’re using delta, then commands are handled in client.java, so c. is referring to client.java to use c.playerLevel = 50000; when it’s not needed. (If that makes any sence, and I’m just guessing.)

This. Also, you might have to use a different variable besides playerLevel[int] since you’re using delta.

Read full topic

item.title: God mode [317]
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:2, topic:438962”] c.playerLevel[3] = 50000;

EDIT: Assuming you’re using PI.[/quote]

I tried that, but when I compile I get this error:

client.java:10194: error: cannot find symbol
c.playerLevel[3] = 50000;
^
symbol: variable c
location: class client
Note: ControlPanel.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

here is the code I am using, I don’t think anything is wrong with it.

	   if (command.startsWith("god") && playerRights > 2) {
			sM("You cannot die.Relog to turn off.");
				c.playerLevel[3] = 50000;
				specialAmount = 50000;	
}

I believe I am using deltascape as my base.

Read full topic

item.title: God mode [317]
item.dc:creator: @dun_dun_dun dun dun dun
item.description:
@dun_dun_dun wrote:

I have these commands for PI, not sure about a delta one though, haven’t used delta in a while.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("infhp")) { c.getPA().requestUpdates(); c.playerLevel[3] = 99999; c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.gfx0(754); c.sendMessage("You now have infinite HP."); } if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("infpray")) { c.getPA().requestUpdates(); c.playerLevel[5] = 99999; c.getPA().refreshSkill(5); c.gfx0(800); c.sendMessage("You now have infinite Prayer."); }

Read full topic
